data.title: Non-Binary Logic

6
true or true
false or false
true or false
true or maybe
maybe or false
maybe or maybe

false
true
true

maybe

maybe or true

maybe and maybe

false
false
maybe
maybe
true

testCases.title: Inverse With Or
testCases.testIn:

not true or true

not false or true

maybe or not false
not maybe or true
false or not maybe
maybe or not maybe
testCases.testOut:

false

true

testCases.testIn:

not maybe and false
not maybe and maybe
testCases.testOut:

false

data.constraints:
6 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 9
3 ≤ Word Count in [[S]] ≤ 4
Count of Operators {{or}} or {{and}} in [[S]] = 1
0 ≤ Count of Modifier {{not}} in [[S]] ≤ 1
Possible operators: {{and}} or {{or}}.
Possible input/output values: {{true}}, {{false}}, and/or {{maybe}}.
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int

loop N read S:string(256)

write true, false, or maybe

STATEMENT
Given N logic statements:
    Has 2 values of "true", "false", and/or "maybe"
    Has 1 operator of "or" or "and"
    Has up to 1 modifier "not" applied to the following value
    Resolve the logic to a singe value of "true", "false", or "maybe"
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer, [[N]], the number of logic statements to solve.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Logic statement String, [[S]], as space separated words for the logic values, operator, and possibly one modifier.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A word that is the result of the logic statement: {{true}}, {{false}}, or {{maybe}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Solve logic statements that could include the value maybe.
The value maybe means "could be true or false".
The modifier not inverts the following value, where:
not false = true, not true = false, not maybe = maybe,
Each statement will have 2 values, 1 operator, and up to 1 modifier.

Examples:
maybe or true = true
maybe or false = maybe
not maybe and true = maybe
false or not false = true
maybe and true = maybe
maybe and false = false
not false and true = true
true and not maybe = maybe
Input
Line 1: An integer, N, the number of logic statements to solve.
Next N lines: Logic statement String, S, as space separated words for the logic values, operator, and possibly one modifier.
Output
Line 1: A word that is the result of the logic statement: true, false, or maybe.
Constraints
6 ≤ N ≤ 9
3 ≤ Word Count in S ≤ 4
Count of Operators or or and in S = 1
0 ≤ Count of Modifier not in S ≤ 1
Possible operators: and or or.
Possible input/output values: true, false, and/or maybe.
Example
Input
6
true or true
false or false
true or false
true or maybe
maybe or false
maybe or maybe
Output
true
false
true
true
maybe
maybe
